intro: Boehmeria cinerascens, commonly known as Chinese nettle or white mulberry, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and small greenish-white flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Its fibers are used in traditional textiles and papermaking, and it is also valued for its medicinal properties. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
